item.name: Blade Random Write Rate % of Max
Drive Array Logical Drive Avg Latency
Drive Array Logical Drive Avg Queue Depth
Drive Array Logical Drive Fault Tolerance
SNMP logs all traffic
item.description: Incorrect SNMP options string in /etc/init.d/snmpd will cause all SNMP traffic to be logged. beginning of OPTIONS= string should be changed from -Lsd to -LS 0-4 d; can used sed command: sed -i 's/OPTIONS=\"-Lsd/OPTIONS=\"-LS 0-4 d/' /etc/init.d/snmpd

item.name: System Product ID
item.description: cpqSiSysProductId OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX DisplayString (SIZE (0..255)) DESCRIPTION "The product id string of the system unit. The string will be empty if the system does not report the product id." ::= { cpqSiAsset 6 }

item.name: System Serial Number
item.description: cpqSiSysSerialNum OBJECT-TYPE SYNTAX DisplayString (SIZE (0..255)) DESCRIPTION "The serial number of the physical system unit. The string will be empty if the system does not report the serial number function." ::= { cpqSiAsset 1 }

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME}: Drive Array Accelerator Condition is Not OK ({ITEM.LASTVALUE})
{HOST.NAME}: Drive Array Logical Drive Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Drive Array Physical Drive 0 Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Drive Array Physical Drive 1 Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Fault Tolerant Fan 0 Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Fault Tolerant Fan Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Health MIB Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: Resilient Memory Condition is Not OK
{HOST.NAME}: SNMP Health MIB Is Not Responding
trigger.description: HP SNMP Health MIB has not reported in over 30 minutes

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} sent new SNMP Trap(s)
trigger.description: Trigger is set on receipt of an SNMP trap, and held until 10 minutes pass with no traps. Check Monitoring -> Latest Data to see if any other traps were sent.
